programme.desc: Comedians Jen Brister and Ian Moore, actor Kelvin Fletcher, and Dr Zoe Williams join the genial giant of quiz to test their general knowledge skills.

programme.desc: The Wildebeest Implementation: Raj attempts to overcome his anxiety about talking to women, while Penny uses Bernadette to spy on Leonard and his girlfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Engagement Reaction: Howard finally tells his mother that he's engaged to Bernadette. Unfortunately, the news lands his mum in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Roommate Transmogrification: Raj decides to move in with Sheldon after hearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Skank Reflex Analysis: Penny worries that she's screwed things up with her friends after her night with Raj. Sheldon takes command of the paintball team.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Math Emergency and Perky Palms: Sheldon and Dr Sturgis fall out when Dr Sturgis marks a question as wrong on Sheldon's test paper. And Mary takes over Pastor Jeff's duties.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Loaf of Bread and a Grand Old Flag: When the taste of his favourite sandwich loaf changes, Sheldon boycotts the bread company and ends up on the local news.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Blazed and Confused: Bart tricks his family into going to a strange desert festival known as Blazing Guy so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new teacher, Mr Lassen.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Covercraft: Homer forms a band with four other dads, but their modest early success is soon overwhelmed by the breakout potential of lead singer Apu.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Werewolf Transformation: Sheldon's well-organised world is turned upside down when he learns that the barber who has cut his hair for years is ill in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Weekend Vortex: Amy is upset when Sheldon breaks his promise to attend her aunt's birthday party in order to join the guys for a Star Wars video game marathon instead.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Transporter Malfunction: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek memorabilia, but she is irked when they refuse to remove the toys from their packaging.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hawking Excitation: When Stephen Hawking comes to lecture at the university, Howard is given the task of maintaining his wheelchair, which makes Sheldon envious.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homr: When Homer loses all the family's money with an unwise investment, he becomes a human guinea pig to earn some cash - and that's when he becomes extremely intelligent...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pokey Mom: Marge notices a prison inmate's artistic talent and helps him to get a job painting a mural at the school. But he clashes with Skinner. Michael Keaton guest stars.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder: Homer bowls a perfect 300 and becomes a celebrity, even appearing on the Springfield Squares with Bumblebee Man and his old nemesis Ron Howard.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Uncut Femmes: Marge gets involved in a jewel heist and learns that there's more to Sarah Wiggum than anyone suspected.

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off...

programme.title: New: Dating Naked UK

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Occupation Recalibration: Penny quits her job at the restaurant to pursue her acting career full-time. Bernadette accidentally destroys one of Howard's comics.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of...
programme.desc: ...Massive Talent: (2022) Nicolas Cage stars as, er, Nic Cage - an unbearably talented actor caught up in a CIA investigation while trying to resurrect his ailing career. With Pedro Pascal.

programme.title: Memory
programme.desc: (2022) Action with Liam Neeson as a septuagenarian hitman; Monica Bellucci as a villain who hires hitmen to hit him, and Guy Pearce as an FBI agent investigating it all.

programme.title: The Real Charlie Chaplin
programme.desc: (2021) Documentary. Who was Charlie Chaplin? A simple enough question on the surface of it. But dig a bit deeper and separating the man from the character he played is a little trickier...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.

programme.title: The Colditz Story
programme.desc: (1954) Classic Second World War drama. John Mills, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes star as just some of the POWs determined to break out of the infamous German 'escape-proof' prison.

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: (2019) Heart-warming comedy based on the real-life story of the Cornish folk ensemble who took the UK charts by storm in 2010, starring Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton.

programme.title: Boston Strangler
programme.desc: (2023) Keira Knightley stars as Loretta McLaughlin, the reporter who fought 60s chauvinism to break the story of the notorious titular serial killer, in Matt Ruskin's true crime procedural.

programme.title: She Said
programme.desc: (2022) Fact-based drama with Zoe Kazan and Carey Mulligan. New York Times journalists Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey investigate the sexual abuses of Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein.

programme.title: French Exit
programme.desc: (2020) Comedy drama with Michelle Pfeiffer. A skint Manhattan socialite moves to Paris with her son and a cat... which may or may not contain the spirit of her dead husband.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard
programme.desc: (1958) Drama. Jack Hawkins stars as Police Inspector Gideon, who faces outrage and danger in his quest to bring London's criminals to justice. With Anna Massey, John Loder and Cyril Cusack.

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.desc: (1954) George Orwell's cautionary tale reimagined in cartoon form. A farm's animals revolt against their abusive owner only for the pigs to become drunk with their newly found power.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fiance, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: American Gangster Special
programme.desc: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe and director Ridley Scott talk about making American Gangster, the 2007 crime epic based on an unlikely true story.

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: (2007) True crime thriller directed by Ridley Scott. An outcast New York cop (Russell Crowe) is charged with bringing down entrepreneurial Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas (Denzel Washington).

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: (2019) Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jennifer Garner, Mila Kunis, John Oliver and Matthew Broderick. A girl's imaginary theme park comes to life when her mum goes to hospital.

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: (2019) Animated spy comedy caper with the voice of Will Smith. The 'world's most awesome spy' gets framed and has to go undercover as a pigeon to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: (2005) Comedy. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his two loves: Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the Boston Red Sox baseball team. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: (2022) Meta-comedy horror 're-quel' with Courteney Cox. Killer Ghostface returns to shock the younger generation out of their love of 'elevated horror' with a bit of old-fashioned slashing.

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of...
programme.desc: ...Massive Talent: (2022) Nicolas Cage stars as, er, Nic Cage - an unbearably talented actor caught up in a CIA investigation while trying to resurrect his ailing career. With Pedro Pascal.

programme.desc: (1954) George Orwell's cautionary tale reimagined in cartoon form. A farm's animals revolt against their abusive owner only for the pigs to become drunk with their newly found power.

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: (1955) Atmospheric Victorian melodrama. Stewart Granger plays a sinister aristocrat who poisons his wife. However, his maid (Jean Simmons) knows his secret and tries to use it against him.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fiance, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: American Gangster Special
programme.desc: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe and director Ridley Scott talk about making American Gangster, the 2007 crime epic based on an unlikely true story.

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: (2007) True crime thriller directed by Ridley Scott. An outcast New York cop (Russell Crowe) is charged with bringing down entrepreneurial Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas (Denzel Washington).

programme.title: The Mechanic
programme.desc: (2011) Thriller with Jason Statham and Donald Sutherland. A hitman is ordered to kill his mentor, but then takes on the dead man's son as an apprentice. Could get complicated... and deadly.

programme.title: A Quiet Place Part II
programme.desc: (2020) Hushed-horror sequel with Emily Blunt and Cillian Murphy. Armed only with a hearing aid, can the family evade the vicious aliens with super-hearing, and find a community to live in?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Wonder Park
programme.desc: (2019) Animated adventure featuring the voices of Jennifer Garner, Mila Kunis, John Oliver and Matthew Broderick. A girl's imaginary theme park comes to life when her mum goes to hospital.

programme.title: Spies in Disguise
programme.desc: (2019) Animated spy comedy caper with the voice of Will Smith. The 'world's most awesome spy' gets framed and has to go undercover as a pigeon to prove his innocence.

programme.title: The Desert Fox
programme.desc: (1951) Drama. James Mason stars in Henry Hathaway's sympathetic portrait of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel in the final years of his life during the Second World War. With Jessica Tandy.

programme.title: The Perfect Catch
programme.desc: (2005) Comedy. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) must choose between his two loves: Lindsey (Drew Barrymore) and the Boston Red Sox baseball team. Based on Nick Hornby's novel Fever Pitch.

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: (2004) Tense sci-fi thriller starring Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid. A scientist sets out to save his son when global warming plunges the world into a sudden climatic catastrophe.

programme.title: The King's Man
programme.desc: (2021) The spy-caper franchise continues with the origins story of the Kingsman agency, as a plucky group battle an international conspiracy at the outbreak of WWI. With Ralph Fiennes.
